moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3: Odd... More common is c4 and I think that's better also.
moves.2... e6 3. e3 c5 4. c3 d5: We both have approximately equal control of the center.
moves.5. Bd3 Nc6 6. Nbd2: Hm, I'm not sure that's best, I'd probably move my knight to a3 so that my DSB could be developed.
moves.6... Bd6 7. e4 cxd4 8. cxd4 dxe4 9. Nxe4: After a series of exchanges, white has slightly stronger center.
moves.10... Bd7 11. Qc2 f5: I chase back his bishop and take more control of the center
moves.16. Re1 Re8: Black is reacting to white, not the other way around so white has the initiative. White also has a space advantage but black has a developmental lead.
moves.20. Qc4: Okay, so now like the idiot I am I let my guard down and guess what happens
moves.20... Bxe1: He can't recapture because of Rxe1#
moves.22. Bh6+: Here I had the dawning misery of knowing I was about to lose when I was up by five points.
moves.22... Kh8 23. Qxf6#: Sigh. Please comment and rate and good job to my opponent.
